emperor.desc: Emperor Seiwa (May 10, 850 - January 7, 881) was the fifty-sixth Emperor (he reigned during the early Heian period).

emperor.name: Emperor Yozei
emperor.desc: Emperor Yozei (January 2, 869 - October 23, 949), the fifty-seventh Emperor, reigned from November 29, 876 to February 4, 884.

emperor.name: Emperor Koko
emperor.desc: Emperor Koko (830 - September 17, 887) was the fifty-eighth Emperor (his reign was from March 23, 884 to September 17, 887).

emperor.name: Emperor Suzaku
emperor.desc: Emperor Suzaku (September 7, 923 - September 6, 952) was the sixty-first Emperor (his reign was from December 14, 930 to May 16, 946).

emperor.name: Emperor Murakami
emperor.desc: Emperor Murakami (July 14, 926 - July 5, 967) reigned in the mid-Heian period (from May 31, 946 to July 5, 967).

emperor.name: Emperor Enyu
emperor.desc: Emperor Enyu (April 12, 959 - March 1, 991) was the sixty-fourth Emperor (his reign was November 5, 969 to September 24, 984).

emperor.name: Emperor Reizei
emperor.desc: Emperor Reizei (June 12, 950 - November 21, 1011) was the sixty-third emperor (his reign was in the mid-Heian period, from November 15, 967 to September 27, 969).

emperor.name: KAZAN Emperor
emperor.desc: Emperor Kazan (November 29, 968 - March 17, 1008) reigned from November 5, 984 - July 31, 986, as the sixty-fifth Emperor.

emperor.name: Emperor Go-Ichijo
emperor.desc: Emperor Go-Ichijo (October 12, 1008 - May 15, 1036), the sixty-eighth Emperor, reigned during the middle Heian period (from 1016 to 1036).

emperor.name: Emperor Go-Suzaku
emperor.desc: Emperor Go-Suzaku (December 14, 1009 - February 7, 1045), the sixty-ninth Emperor, reigned in the middle Heian period (from 1036 to 1045).

emperor.name: Emperor Goreizei
emperor.desc: Emperor Goreizei (August 28, 1025 - May 22, 1068) was the seventieth Japanese Emperor (his reign was from 1045 to 1068).

emperor.name: Emperor Gosanjo
emperor.desc: Emperor Gosanjo (September 3, 1034 - June 15, 1073) was the seventy-first Emperor.

emperor.name: Emperor Horikawa
emperor.desc: Emperor Horikawa (August 8, 1079 - August 9, 1107) was the seventy-third Emperor during the late Heian period (his reign was from 1086 - 1107).

emperor.name: Emperor Toba
emperor.desc: Emperor Toba (February 24, 1103 - July 20, 1156) was the seventy-fourth Emperor in the late Heian period (his reign was from 1107 - 1123).

emperor.name: Emperor Sutoku
emperor.desc: Emperor Sutoku (July 7, 1119 - September 14, 1164) was the seventy-fifth Japanese Emperor (his reign lasted from 1123 to 1142).

emperor.name: KONOE Emperor
emperor.desc: Emperor Konoe (June 16, 1139 - August 22, 1155) was the seventy-sixth Japanese Emperor (his reign was from January 5, 1142 to August 22, 1155).

emperor.name: Emperor Nijo
emperor.desc: Emperor Nijo (July 31, 1143 - September 5, 1165) was the seventy-eighth Emperor (his reign was from September 5, 1158 to August 3, 1165).

emperor.name: Emperor Fushimi
emperor.desc: Emperor Fushimi (May 10, 1265 - October 8, 1317) was the ninety-second Japanese Emperor. (his reign was November 27, 1287 - August 30, 1298.)

emperor.name: Emperor Sakuramachi
emperor.desc: Emperor Sakuramachi (February 8, 1720 - May 28, 1750), the 115th Emperor, reigned during the Edo period (from April 13, 1735 to June 9, 1747).

emperor.name: Emperor Gomizunoo
emperor.desc: Emperor Gomizunoo (June 29, 1596 - September 11, 1680) was the 108th Emperor (his reign lasted from May 9, 1611 to December 22, 1629).

emperor.name: Emperor Gokomyo
emperor.desc: Emperor Gokomyo (April 20, 1633 - October 30, 1654), the 110th Emperor, reigned during the Edo period (from November 14, 1643 to October 30, 1654).

emperor.name: Emperor Gosai
emperor.desc: Emperor Gosai (January 1, 1638 - March 26, 1685), the 111th Emperor, reigned during the Edo period (from January 5, 1655 to March 5, 1663).

emperor.name: Emperor Kokaku
emperor.desc: Emperor Kokaku (September 23, 1771 - December 11, 1840), the 119th Emperor, reigned during the Edo period from December 16, 1779 to May 7, 1817.

emperor.name: Emperor Gokashiwabara
emperor.desc: Emperor Gokashiwabara (November 19, 1464 - May 19, 1526) was the 104th Emperor, reigning from November 16, 1500 to May 19, 1526 in the Muromachi and Sengoku (warring states) periods, the latter being the period of civil wars between rival daimyo.

emperor.name: Emperor Gotsuchimikado
emperor.desc: Emperor Gotsuchimikado (July 3, 1442 - October 21, 1500), the 103rd Emperor, reigned in the Muromachi period from August 21, 1464 to October 21, 1500.

emperor.name: Emperor Gokomatsu
emperor.desc: Emperor Gokomatsu (August 1, 1377 - December 1, 1433) was the sixth and last Emperor of the Muromachi period (Northern Court), or the 100th Emperor (his reign was from May 24, 1382 to October 5, 1412).

emperor.name: Emperor Gonijo
emperor.desc: Emperor Gonijo (March 9, 1285 - September 10, 1308) was the ninety-fourth Emperor during Kamakura period. (his reign was from March 3, 1301to September 10, 1308)

emperor.name: Emperor Rokujo
emperor.desc: Emperor Rokujo (December 28, 1164 - August 23, 1176) was the seventy-ninth Emperor in Japan. (his reign was from August 3, 1165 to March 30, 1168.)

emperor.name: Emperor Takakura
emperor.desc: Emperor Takakura (September 23, 1161 - February 6 1181, his reign was from March 30, 1168 to March 18, 1180, cloister government was 1180), he was the eightieth Emperor.

emperor.name: Emperor Tsuchimikado
emperor.desc: Emperor Tsuchimikado (January 3, 1196 - November 6, 1231) was the eighty-third Emperor during the Kamakura period. (his reign was from February 18, 1198 to December 12, 1210.)

emperor.name: Emperor Kogon
emperor.desc: Emperor Kogon (August 1, 1313 - August 5, 1364), his reign was from October 22, 1331 to July 7, 1333) and he was the first Emperor of Northern Court during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Emperor Komyo
emperor.desc: Emperor Komyo (January 11, 1322 - July 26, 1380) his reign was from September 20, 1336 to November 18, 1348, he was the second Emperor of the Northern Court during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Emperor Suko
emperor.desc: Emperor Suko (May 25, 1334 - January 31, 1398), his reign was from November 18, 1348 to November 26, 1351, he was the third Emperor of the Northern Court during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Emperor Gokogon
emperor.desc: Emperor Gokogon (March 23, 1338 - March 12, 1374), his reign was from September 25, 1352 to April 9, 1371, he was the fourth Emperor of the Northern Court during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Emperor Goenyu
emperor.desc: Emperor Goenyu (January 11, 1359 - June 6, 1393), his reign was from April 9, 1371 to May 24, 1382, he was the fifth Northern Court Emperor of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Empress Meisho
emperor.desc: Empress Meisho (January 9, 1624 - December 4, 1696) was the hundred-ninth Emperor. (her reign was from December 22, 1629 to November 14, 1643.)

emperor.name: Emperor Shoko
emperor.desc: Emperor Shoko (May 12, 1401 - August 30, 1428), his reign was from October 5, 1412 to August 30, 1428, he was the hundred and first Emperor of the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Emperor Gohanazono
emperor.desc: Emperor Gohanazono (July 10, 1419 - January 18, 1471), his reign was from September 7, 1428 to August 21, 1464, he was the hundred and second Emperor during the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Emperor Gonara
emperor.desc: Emperor Gonara (January 26, 1497 - September 27, 1557) was the hundred fifth Emperor during the Muromachi and the Warring States period; the period of civil wars between rival daimyo. (his reign was from June 9, 1526 to September 27, 1557)

emperor.name: Emperor Goyozei
emperor.desc: Emperor Goyozei (December 31, 1571 - September 25, 1617), his reign was from December 17, 1586 to May 9, 1611, he was the hundred and seventh Emperor between the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the Edo period.

emperor.name: Emperor Nakamikado
emperor.desc: Emperor Nakamikado (January 14, 1702 - May 10, 1737), his reign was From July 27, 1709 to April 13, 1735, he was the hundred fourteenth Emperor during Edo period.

emperor.name: Emperor Momozono
emperor.desc: Emperor Momozono (April 14, 1741 - August 31, 1762) was the hundred sixteenth Emperor during the Edo period. (his reign was from June 9, 1747 to August 31, 1762.)

emperor.name: Empress Gosakuramachi
emperor.desc: Empress Gosakuramachi (September 23, 1740 - December 24, 1813) was the hundred seventeenth Emperor, her reign was from September 15, 1762 - January 9, 1771.

emperor.name: Emperor Gomomozono
emperor.desc: Emperor Gomomozono (August 5, 1758 - December 6, 1779) was the hundred eighteenth Emperor during the Edo period. (his reign was from May 23, 1770 to December 16, 1779.)

emperor.name: Emperor Juntoku
emperor.desc: Emperor Juntoku (October 22, 1197 - October 7, 1242) was the eighty fourth Emperor during the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Emperor Chukyo
emperor.desc: Emperor Chukyo (October 30, 1218 -June 18, 1234) was the eighty fifth Emperor during the Kamakura period. (his reign was from May 13, 1221 to July 29, 1221.)

emperor.name: Emperor Gohorikawa
emperor.desc: Emperor Gohorikawa (March 22, 1212 - August 31, 1234) was the eighty sixth Emperor during the Kamakura period (his reign was from July 29, 1221 to November 17, 1232).

emperor.name: Emperor Shijo
emperor.desc: Emperor Shijo (March 17, 1231 - February 10, 1242) was the eighty seventh Emperor (his reign was from October 26, 1232 to February 10, 1242).

emperor.name: Emperor Gosaga
emperor.desc: Emperor Gosaga (April 1, 1220 - March 17, 1272) was the eighty eighth Emperor during the Kamakura period (his reign was from February 21, 1242 to February 16, 1246).

emperor.name: Emperor Gofukakusa
emperor.desc: Emperor Gofukakusa (June 28, 1243 - August 17, 1304) was the eighty ninth Emperor during the Kamakura period (his reign was from February 16, 1246 to January 9, 1259).

emperor.name: Emperor Kameyama
emperor.desc: Emperor Kameyama (July 9, 1249 - October 4, 1305) was the ninetieth Emperor during the Kamakura period (his reign was from January 9, 1259 to March 6, 1274).

emperor.name: Emperor Gouda
emperor.desc: Emperor Gouda (December 17, 1267 - July 16, 1324) was the ninety first Emperor during the Kamakura period (his reign was from March 6, 1274 to November 27, 1287).

emperor.name: Emperor Gofushimi
emperor.desc: Emperor Gofushimi (April 5, 1288 - May 17, 1336) was the ninety third Emperor during the Kamakura period (his reign was from August 30, 1298 to March 2, 1301).

emperor.name: Emperor Hanazono
emperor.desc: Emperor Hanazono (August 14, 1297 - December 2, 1348) was the ninety fifth Emperor during the Kamakura period. (his reign was from December 2, 1308 to March 29, 1318.)

emperor.name: Emperor Goshirakawa
emperor.desc: Emperor Goshirakawa (October 18, 1127 - April 26, 1192), his reign was from August 23, 1155 to September 5, 1158, he was the seventy seventh Emperor in the late Heian Period.

emperor.name: Fushimi no Miya
emperor.desc: Fushimi no Miya is one of the Miyake (house of imperial prince).

emperor.name: TACHIBANA no Kachiko
emperor.desc: TACHIBANA no Kachiko (786 - June 17, 850) was the Empress of the fifty-second Emperor Saga.

emperor.name: Kan in no Miya
emperor.desc: The Kan in no Miya was one of the four hereditary Imperial families, and it was a Miyake (house of an imperial prince) which was founded by Emperor Higashiyama's Prince, Kan in no Miya Imperial Prince Naohito during middle of the Edo period.

emperor.name: Kuni no Miya
emperor.desc: Kuni no Miya was the Miyake (house of an imperial prince) established by Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Kuniie's fourth Prince, Kuni no Miya Imperial Prince Asahiko during the early Meiji period.

emperor.name: Komatsu no Miya
emperor.desc: Komatsu no Miya was established by the Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Kuniie's eighth Prince, Komatsu no Miya Imperial Prince, Akihito during the early Meiji period.

emperor.name: Nashimoto no Miya
emperor.desc: Nashimoto no Miya was the Miyake (house of an imperial prince) established by Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadayoshi's Imperial Prince, Prince Moriosa.

emperor.name: Katsura Rikyu (Katsura Imperial Villa)
emperor.desc: Katsura Rikyu is the detached Palace (a palace built apart from the Imperial Palace) located at Katsura, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.

emperor.name: Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Taruhito
emperor.url: emperor/Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Taruhito.html
emperor.desc: Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Taruhito (March 17, 1835 - January 15, 1895) was a member of the Imperial family, a politician, and a military officer between the last days of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and the Meiji period.

emperor.name: TOKUGAWA Masako (Kazuko)
emperor.desc: Masako TOKUGAWA (November 23, 1607 - August 2, 1678) was the 5th daughter of Hidetada TOKUGAWA and Emperor Gomizunoo's Chugu (second consort of an Emperor).

emperor.name: Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Takehito
emperor.url: emperor/Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Takehito.html
emperor.desc: Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Takehito (February 11, 1862 - July 5, 1913), Japanese Imperial family, soldier.

emperor.name: Miyake (house of an imperial prince)
emperor.desc: Miyake is the name of the successive Imperial family in Japan allowed to have Imperial rank.

emperor.name: Prince Mochihito
emperor.desc: Prince Mochihito (1151 - June 20, 1180) was one of the Imperial family members during the end of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Shugakuin Imperial Villa
emperor.desc: Shugakuin Imperial Villa is a detached Palace within the Imperial Household Agency's jurisdiction, and it is located at the foot of Mt. Hiei in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi/Tsunenaga
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi/Tsunenage (1324 - May 3, 1338) was Emperor Godaigo's Prince.

emperor.name: TAIRA no Tokuko/Tokushi/Noriko
emperor.desc: TAIRA no Tokuko/Tokushi/Noriko (1155 - January 25, 1214) was the Chugu (the second consort of an emperor) of Emperor Takakura and Nyoin (the respective title given to emperor's mother or Sanko or Princesses by the Imperial Palace) during the late Heian period.

emperor.name: Kazunomiya Imperial Princess Chikako
emperor.desc: Kazunomiya Imperial Princess Chikako (July 3, 1846 - September 2, 1877) was a woman who lived during the late Edo period, she was a wife of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), fourteenth Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA.

emperor.name: Gyoko
emperor.desc: "Gyoko" (Miyuki) is a Japanese term used to refer to the visit of the Emperor.

emperor.name: Katsuranomiya
emperor.desc: Katsuranomiya is one of the Miyake (houses of an imperial princes) and also one of the four heredity Imperial prince' families.

emperor.name: Takamikura
emperor.desc: Takamikura is the special Imperial throne which designates the official place where the Emperor sits.

emperor.name: Kokokushikan
emperor.desc: Kokokushikan is the understanding that Japanese people live in Japan, a country with a history of successive Emperors, lore and the history of which was passed from generation to generation to the present.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Muneyoshi/Munenaga
emperor.desc: Imperial prince Muneyoshi/Munenaga (1311 - September 14, 1385) was an Imperial family member during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, and was Emperor Godaigo's Prince, who was called Shinanonomiya, Okusanomiya, Kosakanomiya (originating from the Kosaka clan who became the protector).

emperor.name: TAIRA no Takamochi
emperor.desc: TAIRA no Takamochi (Prince Takamochi) (October 21, 839 - June 28, 911) was the Seishi Imperial family (Imperial family given surname by the Emperor) during the Middle Heian Period.

emperor.name: Shinseki Koka (demotion from nobility to subject)
emperor.url: emperor/Shinseki Koka (demotion from nobility to subject).html
emperor.desc: Shinseki koka is when a member of the Imperial Family leaves their position and becomes a common subject giving up their nobility status, after given a new surname.

emperor.name: Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Sadafusa
emperor.desc: Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Sadafusa (April 9, 1372 - September 28, 1456) was a member of the Imperial family during the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Sanehito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Sanehito (May 16, 1552 - September 7, 1586) was a member of the Imperial family in the Azuchimomoyama period.

emperor.name: Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Sukehito
emperor.desc: Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Sukehito (April 1, 1733 - August 1, 1794) was the head of the Miyake (house of an imperial prince) in Edo period and member of the Imperial family.

emperor.name: Nairan
emperor.desc: Nairan is to check and read any document for the Emperor to read, or for Emperor to make decision about, or the position of Ryoge no Kan (a position which is not included in the regulations).

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Takaoka
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Takaoka (799 - 865) was a member of the Imperial family and a priest during early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Shigehito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Shigehito (1140 - 1162) was one of the Imperial family members during the late Heian period.

emperor.name: TAIRA no Shigeko
emperor.desc: TAIRA no Shigeko (1142 - August 14, 1176) was Emperor Goshirakawa's Empress after the Emperor succeeded to the throne.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Shoshi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Shoshi, also pronounced Tamako (1101 - September 10, 1145) was the mother of the emperor in the late Heian period.

emperor.name: Succession to the Imperial Throne
emperor.desc: Succession to the Imperial Throne generally means to pass the Imperial Throne (the position of the Emperor) to the Crown Prince or the successor of the Imperial Throne.

emperor.name: Fujiwara no Taishi
emperor.desc: Fujiwara no Taishi, also pronounced Yasuko (1095 - January 10, 1156) was the Empress, Nyoin (an honorific title for the mother of emperor(s), etc.) during late Heian period.

emperor.name: Daidairi
emperor.desc: Daidairi is an Imperial Palace in the ancient capital of Heian.

emperor.name: The Meitoku Settlement
emperor.desc: The Meitoku Settlement was the agreement held in 1392 between the Southern Court (Daikakuji Imperial Line) and the Northern Court (Jimyoin Imperial Line) in terms of peace negotiation and the Imperial succession.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Sakahito
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Sakahito (754 - September 25, 829) was Emperor Konin's Princess.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Asahara
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Asahara, also pronounced Ashitahara (779 - May 18, 817) was the Princess of Emperor Kanmu and Imperial Princess Sakahito.

emperor.name: Rikyu (an Imperial villa)
emperor.desc: Rikyu is an Imperial villa which is separate from the Imperial Palace or Palace.

emperor.name: Chiten no Kimi
emperor.desc: Chiten no Kimi was the word for the retired emperor or emperor who took control of politics as the head of Imperial Family from ancient times to the Medieval period.

emperor.name: The Former Imperial Family
emperor.desc: The former Imperial Family is the colloquial term of Imperial Family members who ceased to be a member of the Imperial Family in 1947, consisted of 51 members of 11 Miyake (house of an imperial prince) and their male descendants.

emperor.name: Imperial prince Takayoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial prince Takayoshi, also pronounced Takanaga (1310 - April 7, 1337) was Emperor Godaigo's Prince.

emperor.name: Emperor Higashiyama
emperor.desc: Emperor Higashiyama (October 21, 1675 - January 16, 1710) was the hundred and thirteenth Emperor during Edo period. (his reign was May 6, 1687 - July 27, 1709)

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi, also pronounced Kuninaga (1300 - April 23, 1326) was the first Prince of Emperor Gonijo of the Daikakuji Imperial line.

emperor.name: Emperor Komei
emperor.desc: Emperor Komei (July 22, 1831 - January 30, 1867) was the Emperor during late Edo period. (the hundred twenty first Emperor, his reign was from March 10, 1846 to January 30, 1867)

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Akiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Akiko (April 29, 1137 - August 6, 1211) was an Imperial Family member during the end of the Heian period to early Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Noriko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Noriko (also pronounced Shokushi and Shikishi) (1149 - March 1, 1201) was a member of the Imperial Family in the late Heian period, a poet.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kideranomiya Yasuhito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kideranomiya Yasuhito (1320 - June 10, 1355) was a member of the Imperial Family in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, and he was Emperor Kogon's Crown Prince of Jimyoin Imperial line.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Tsuneaki
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Tsuneaki, also pronounced Tsuneakira (June 24, 1303 - September 26, 1351) was a member of the Imperial Family belonging to the Daikakuji Imperial line of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts and the youngest child of Emperor Kameyama.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Morisada
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Morisada (April 6, 1179 - June 14, 1223) was the second Prince of Emperor Takakura, and his mother was Nobutaka BOMON's daughter, Shokushi BOMON. (Shichijoin)

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Abo
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Abo (792 - December 1, 842) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Emperor Meiji
emperor.desc: Emperor Meiji (November 3, 1852 - July 30, 1912) was the hundred and twenty second Emperor. (his reign was 1867 - 1912)

emperor.name: Prince Masami
emperor.desc: Prince Masami (798 - May 863) (old calendar) was an Imperial Family member during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Katsuranomiya Sumiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Katsuranomiya Sumiko (February 22, 1829 - October 3, 1881) was Emperor Ninko's third Princess.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Yoshiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Yoshiko (September 30, 1714 - October 23, 1758) was the thirteenth Princess of Emperor Reigen.

emperor.name: Cloistered Imperial Prince Sonen
emperor.desc: Cloistered Imperial Prince Sonen (August 1, 1298 - October 7, 1356) was the seventeenth Chief Priest of Shoren-in Temple.

emperor.name: Cloistered Imperial Prince Soncho
emperor.desc: Cloistered Prince Soncho (September 8, 1552 - March 30, 1597) was the sixth Prince of Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kunisuke.

emperor.name: Female Emperor
emperor.desc: It means Emperor who was woman.

emperor.name: The Ariwara clan
emperor.desc: The Ariwara clan originated from Emperor Heizei's Prince, Imperial Prince Abo and Imperial Prince Takaoka's children were demoted from nobility to subject, and they were the clan whose ancestors were from Imperial Family. (Please refer to the Imperial Family members who were demoted from nobility to subject.)

emperor.name: Dairi (the Imperial palace)
emperor.desc: "Dairi" is the emperor's private area in the palace of ancient walled city.

emperor.name: Female-line Emperor
emperor.desc: The term "Female-line Emperor" (Jokei Tenno) refers to an Emperor of Japan who is a descendent of the imperial line only on his/her mother's side; such an emperor may also be referred to as a `Mother-line Emperor.'

emperor.name: Mikotonori
emperor.desc: "Mikotonori" (詔 or 御言宣), or "Omikoto" (大御言) was a document of the emperor's words or orders to be directly conveyed.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Senshi (Nobuko)
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Senshi (Nobuko) (June 11, 964 - July 29, 1035) was the tenth Princess of the sixty-second Emperor Murakami.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tomohira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tomohira (August 4, 964 - August 21, 1009) was the seventh prince of the sixty-second Emperor Murakami.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Shigeakira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Shigeakira (906 - October 13, 954) was the forth prince of Emperor Daigo.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Shoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Shoshi (her given name can also be pronounced "Akiko") (January 19, 1027 - October 26, 1105) was the first daughter of the sixty-eighth emperor, Emperor Goichijo.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Masako
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Masako was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family.

emperor.name: Princess Kishi
emperor.desc: Princess Kishi (her given name can also be pronounced "Hiroko") (date of birth unknown - May 24, 950) was a royal princess of Imperial Prince Yasuakira (Emperor Daigo's son).

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Onshi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Onshi/Yasuko (885 - February 9, 954) was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Mototsune.

emperor.name: Goryosha
emperor.desc: Goryosha is a car which is designed for the Japanese Emperor and the Imperial family.

emperor.name: MINAMOTO no Yoshiari
emperor.desc: MINAMOTO no Yoshiari (845 - July 11, 897) was an aristocrat and politician who lived in the Heian period.

emperor.name: Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshihito
emperor.desc: Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshihito (February 3, 1579 - May 29, 1629) was a member of the imperial family who lived from the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) to the early Edo period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Sonshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Sonshi (966 - May 24, 985) was the second Princess of the sixty-third Emperor Reizei.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Teishi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Teishi (Yoshiko/Sadako) (August 15, 1013 - February 3, 1094) was the sixty-seventh Emperor Sanjo's third Princess.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Koretaka
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Koretaka (844 - March 30, 897) was an Imperial family member during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Noshi
emperor.desc: Noshi were the everyday clothes for Emperors, Crown Princes, Imperial Princes or other court nobles after Heian period (the Heian costume).

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Teishi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Teishi (Yasuko) (May 10, 1076 - August 27, 1096) was the seventy-second Emperor Shirakawa's first Princess.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Uchiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Uchiko (807 - December 7, 847) was the fifty-second Emperor Saga's Princess.

emperor.name: Shinkan
emperor.desc: Shinkan is a document handwritten by the emperor.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Saneyasu
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Saneyasu (831 - June 14, 872) was an Imperial family member in Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tamehira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tamehira (952 - December 15, 1010) was a member of the Imperial family during the Heian period and Emperor Murakami's fourth Prince.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Yoshiakira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Yoshiakira (904 - May 12, 937) was a member of the Imperial family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Yasuakira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Yasuakira (December 16, 903 - April 14, 923) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kaneakira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kaneakira (914 - 987) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: The monk-Imperial Prince Kakugyo
emperor.desc: The monk-Imperial Prince Kakugyo Hosshino (April 1075 - December 26, 1105) was a member of the Imperial Family and a monk of the middle to the late Heian period.

emperor.name: The monk-Imperial Prince Gyonen
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Gyonen (November 16, 1602 - October 15, 1661) was a member of the Imperial Family and a monk during the early Edo period.

emperor.name: The Monk Imperial Prince Shukaku
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Shukaku (April 3, 1150 - September 13, 1202) was a member of the Imperial Family and a monk from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Priest-Imperial Prince Kakusho
emperor.desc: Priest-Imperial Prince Kakusho (1129 - December 30, 1169) was a member of the Imperial Family, a monk and a poet during the late Heian period.

emperor.name: The Monk-Imperial Prince Kakuho
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Kakuho (February 9, 1092 - December 22, 1153) was a member of the Imperial Family and a monk during the late Hein period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tsunesada
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tsunesada (825 - October 12, 884) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Atsumi
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Atsumi (893 - April 14, 967) was the 8th prince of the Emperor Uda.

emperor.name: Cloistered Imperial Prince Chokaku
emperor.desc: Cloistered Imperial Prince Chokaku (1219 - 1289) was a chief priest of Sanzen-in Temple of the Tendai sect during the Kamakura Period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Sukehito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Sukehito (February 28, 1073 - December 31, 1119) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Yoyoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Yoyoshi (as known as Imperial Prince Tokinaga, birth year unknown - October 29, 1330) was a member of the Imperial family during the late Kamakura Period.

emperor.name: Chokushiden
emperor.desc: Chokushiden is a farm developed under the edict of the Emperor in ancient Japan, it was used to provide funding for the Imperial Household.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Naohito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Naohito (1335 - June 10, 1395) was a member of the Imperial Family of the Jimyo-in Imperial line in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Shinjaku
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Shinjaku (886 - October 13, 927) was the Monk-Imperial Prince in the middle of the Heian Period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Yamashinanomiya Akira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Yamashinanomiya Akira (October 22, 1816 - February 17, 1898) was a member of the Imperial family in Japan.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Joson
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Joson (date of birth and death unknown) was the Monk-Imperial Prince from the latter half of the Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Gyoin
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Gyoin (1458 - 1520) was the Monk-Imperial Prince from the middle of the Muromachi period to Warring States period.

emperor.name: Cloistered Imperial Prince Gyoen
emperor.desc: Cloistered Imperial Prince Gyoen (years of birth and death unknown) was a cloistered imperial prince during the Kamakura and Northern and Southern Court periods.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Jido
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Jido (1282 - April 27, 1341) was the Monk-Imperial Prince from the latter half of Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Cloistered Imperial Prince Gyoen
emperor.desc: Cloistered Imperial Prince Gyoen (January 31, 1677 - January 19, 1719) was a cloistered imperial prince during the early to mid Edo Period.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Jiun
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Gyoin (1466 - 1537) was the Monk-Imperial Prince during the Warring States period.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Shoin
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Shoin (1317 - May 16, 1377) was the Monk-Imperial Prince from the end of Kamaura period to the period of the Northern and Souther Courts.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Honin
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Honin (1325 - December 2, 1352) was the Monk-Imperial Prince during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Seijo
emperor.desc: Monk Imperial Prince Seijo (date of birth and death unknown) was the Monk Imperial Prince during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Monk-Imperial Prince Sonjo
emperor.desc: Monk-Imperial Prince Sonjo (1217 - January 2, 1291) was a Monk-Imperial Prince during the middle of the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Nochi no Sanbo (三房)
emperor.desc: `Nochi no Sanbo' refers to the three; Chikafusa KITABATAKE, Nobufusa MADENOKOJI, Sadafusa YOSHIDA, who served as aides of Emperor Godaigo from the end of Kamakura period to the period of the Southern and Northern Courts.

emperor.name: Shigaraki no miya
emperor.desc: Shigaraki no miya is the detached palace in Koga gun (county side), Omi Province (present-day Shigaraki-cho, Koga City, Shiga Prefecture) that was operated by Emperor Shomu during the Nara period.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Masaruko
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Masaruko (1140 - January 19, 1202) was the Empress at the end of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Nashimotonomiya Moriosa
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Nashimotonomiya Moriosa (December 16, 1819 - September 1, 1881) was a member of the Imperial family of Japan during the late Edo and Meiji Periods.

emperor.name: HIGASHIFUSHIMI Jigo
emperor.desc: Jigo HIGASHIFUSHIMI (May 16, 1910 -) is a Buddhist monk in Japan.

emperor.name: SAIONJI Neishi
emperor.desc: Neishi SAIONJI (her name can also be pronounced "Yasuko") (1292 - September 6, 1357) was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court; a consort of the emperor) of Emperor Gofushimi; she was the mother of Emperor Kogon and Emperor Komyo.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Satonari
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Satonari (July 22, 1856 - February 10, 1872) was a member of the Imperial family of Japan during the late Edo and early Meiji Periods.

emperor.name: NIWATA Hideko
emperor.desc: Hideko NIWATA (year of birth unknown - May 4, 1685) was Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) of Emperor Gokomyo.

emperor.name: Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshitada
emperor.desc: Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshitada (November 24, 1620 - August 20, 1662) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family who lived in the early Edo period.

emperor.name: Princess Akiko
emperor.desc: Princess Akiko (1638 - August 2, 1680) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family.

emperor.name: TAKATSUKASA Fusako
emperor.desc: Fusako TAKATSUKASA (October 12, 1653 - May 19, 1712) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family.

emperor.name: MINAMOTO no Hikaru (court noble)
emperor.desc: MINAMOTO no Hikaru (July 9, 845 - April 21, 913) was a court noble who lived in the Heian period.

emperor.name: Miketsukuni
emperor.desc: Miketsukuni indicated the supply provinces making offerings, namely the province that was assumed to supply food (secondary diet component except for grain), mainly marine products, to the Imperial family and Imperial court, from ancient Japan to the Heian period.

emperor.name: Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito
emperor.desc: Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito (April 29, 1603 - July 14, 1638) was a member of Japanese Imperial Family who lived in the early Edo period.

emperor.name: Honcho Koin Joun roku
emperor.desc: Honcho Koin Joun roku is a genealogy of Emperors and Imperial Families.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori (October 26, 1836 - December 16, 1862) was a member of the Imperial family during the late Edo Period.

emperor.name: Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Sadatake
emperor.desc: Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Sadatake (January 29, 1701 - September 7, 1754) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived during the middle of the Edo period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Masanari
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Masanari (October 20, 1200 - March 19, 1255) was a member of the Japanese imperial family who lived in the early Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito (October 28, 1713 - November 19, 1769) was a member of the Imperial family during the Edo period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Tatsuhito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Tatsuhito (June 17, 1792 - March 9, 1824) was a member of the Imperial family during the Edo Period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kyogokunomiya Ayahito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kyogokunomiya Ayahito (September 8, 1680 - April 23, 1711) was a member of the Imperial family during the middle of the Edo period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kyogokunomiya Yakahito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kyogokunomiya Yakahito (May 4, 1704 - January 25, 1768) was a Japanese Imperial family member in the middle of the Edo period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Yoshihito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Yoshihito

emperor.name: Prince Fushiminomiya Haruhito
emperor.desc: Prince Fushiminomiya Haruhito (1370 - February 28, 1417) was a Japanese Imperial family member during the period of the Northern and Southern Court and the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Yoshiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Yoshiko (March 11, 1779 - August 11, 1846) was a member of the Imperial family member during the Edo period.

emperor.name: SAIONJI Kishi
emperor.desc: Kishi SAIONJI (1303 - November 19, 1333) was a Japanese Imperial family member during the late Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayasu
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayasu (February 1, 1547 - May 11, 1568) was an Imperial family member during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunisuke
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunisuke (April 25, 1513 - April 18, 1563) was an Imperial family member during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadaatsu
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadaatsu (March, 1488 - September 2, 1572) was the Imperial family member during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunitaka
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunitaka (March 8, 1456 - April 24, 1532) was an Imperial family member during the late Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadatsune
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadatsune (January 27, 1426 - August 15, 1474) was an Imperial family member during the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Junshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Junshi (March 13, 1311 - June 11, 1337) was Emperor Godaigo's Chugu (Empress).

emperor.name: Hokurokunomiya
emperor.desc: Hokurokunomiya (1165 - August 17, 1230) was an Imperial family member between the late Heian period to the early Kamamura period.

emperor.name: Shosei
emperor.desc: Shosei means new emperor (mainly Crown Prince or Empress) starts to rule the government without having an enthronement ceremony after the former emperor died.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Takaiko
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Takaiko (842 - April 18, 910) was the Nyogo (imperial consort) of Emperor Seiwa during the Heian period.

emperor.name: MINAMOTO no Kiyohime
emperor.desc: MINAMOTO no Kiyohime (810 - August 3, 856) was Emperor Saga's Princess.

emperor.name: Shinkoku (divine land)
emperor.desc: Shinkoku (Shinshu) means 'country of God'

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Akihira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Akihira (954 - August 7, 1013) was an Imperial family member in the Heian period.

emperor.name: The Emperor (Tenno)
emperor.desc: It is the royal crest of the Emperor and the Emperor's family.

emperor.name: Fukai-no-Joten/ Fukaijoten (Irreversible Permanent Code/ Irreversible Eternal Code)
emperor.url: emperor/Fukai-no-Joten Fukaijoten (Irreversible Permanent Code Irreversible Eternal Code).html
emperor.desc: Fukai-no-Joten/ Fukaijoten (Irreversible Permanent Code/ Irreversible Eternal Code) is a law frequently referred to in the enthronement address of Japanese successive emperors since the year 707, and is said to have been established by Emperor Tenchi (his name is also pronounced "Tenji").

emperor.name: TAKATSUKASA Masahiro
emperor.desc: Masahiro TAKATSUKASA (May 14, 1761 - March 29, 1841) was a member of court nobles during the mid Edo period.

emperor.name: Satodairi (temporary imperial palace)
emperor.desc: Satodairi means residences of the Emperor (imperial palaces) except for the dairi (the Emperor's residential compound) in Heian-kyu palace, used after the Heian period.

emperor.name: The Bunpo Compromise
emperor.desc: The Bunpo Compromise is an agreement made in 1317, the late Kamakura period, that succession to the throne would alternate between descendants of Emperor Gofukakusa (Jimyoin-to - imperial lineage from Emperor Gofukakusa to Emperor Gokomatsu) and descendants of Emperor Kameyama (Daikakuji-to - imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) (both were the sons of Emperor Gosaga).

emperor.name: TAIRA no Takamune
emperor.desc: TAIRA no Takamune, or Prince Takamune, (804 - June 24, 867) was a shisei kozoku (member of the Imperial Family conferred with a family name) of the early Heian period who was given the surname TAIRA.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Nobuko
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Nobuko (809 - November 11, 871) was a nyogo (imperial consort) of the 54th Emperor Ninmyo.

emperor.name: MINAMOTO no Hiromu
emperor.desc: MINAMOTO no Hiromu (812 - February 16, 863) was a court noble during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Kayain (a residence)
emperor.desc: Kayain was one of the Satodairi (temporary imperial residence) in Heian-kyo.

emperor.name: Toba Rikyu (Toba Imperial villa)
emperor.desc: Toba Rikyu was used as a villa by generations of "Daijo-Tenno" (retired emperors) from the 12th to around the 14th century.

emperor.name: The Yotsutsujinomiya family
emperor.desc: The Yotsutsujinomiya family is one of the houses of Imperial princes that existed during the Kamakura Period.

emperor.name: The Itsutsujinomiya family
emperor.desc: The Itsutsujinomiya family is one of the households of Imperial princes that existed in the late Kamakura Period to the early Southern and Northern Court period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Matahito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tokiwain miya Matahito (1321 - August 23, 1367) was a member of the Imperial family during the early Muromachi Period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Mitsuhito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Mitsuhito (1354 - November 16, 1426) was a member of the Imperial family during the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Prince Tokiwainomiya Naohito
emperor.desc: Prince Tokiwainomiya Naohito (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family during the Muromachi period, and was the 4th head of the Tokiwainomiya family.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Mataakira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Mataakira (1439 - January 14, 1522) was a member of the Imperial family during the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Tsunenao
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tokiwainomiya Tsunenao (date of birth unknown - August, 1552) was a member of the Imperial family during the late Muromachi period, and was the last head of the Tokiwainomiya family.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kideranomiya Kuniyasu
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kideranomiya Kuniyasu (1416 - date of death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family during the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Tsubokiri no Mitsurugi (the sword Tsubokiri)
emperor.desc: Tsubokiri no Mitsurugi is hoken (treasured sword) which has been handed down to the successive Crown Princes in Japan.

emperor.name: Rinji (the Emperor's command)
emperor.desc: Rinji meant a document of decree issued by Kurodo (Chamberlain) in response to the Emperor's intention.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Yasuko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Yasuko (her given name can be also pronounced as "Koshi") (919 - 957) is considered to have been the 4th wife of FUJIWRA no Morosuke, who was a member of the Imperial family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Shishinden Hall (Hall for state ceremonies)
emperor.desc: The Shishinden Hall was a main hall where ceremonies like the Emperor's genpuku (attaining manhood), investiture of the Crown Prince, and Sechi-e (seasonal court banquets) were held, in the Imperial Palace which was the Emperor's private place.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Muneko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Muneko (August 20, 1126 - September 9, 1189) was the daughter of Emperor Toba (her mother was Empress FUJIWARA no Shoshi), and she had two maternal brothers, Emperor Sutoku and Emperor Goshirakawa.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Kuniko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Kuniko (1209 - October 3, 1283) was a member of the Imperial family during the Kamakura period, and was nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing).

emperor.name: Kamonomiya
emperor.desc: Kamonomiya (November 21, 1618 - November 4, 1622) was a member of the Imperial family in the early part of the Edo period.

emperor.name: NIJO Ieko
emperor.desc: Ieko NIJO (October 9, 1716 - March 14, 1790) was Emperor Sakuramachi's nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court - a consort of the emperor) and the mother of Empress Gosakuramachi.

emperor.name: SAIONJI Kitsushi
emperor.desc: Kitsushi SAIONJI (1225 - October 20, 1292) was the Chugu (Empress) to Emperor Gosaga, and later became Empress Dowager.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince and Monk Ryojun
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince and Monk Ryojun (January 18, 1604 - August 27, 1669) was a member of the Imperial family of the early Edo Period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Kyushi (Yasuko)
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Kyushi (Yasuko) (1157 - April 7, 1171) was a member of the Imperial family at the end of the Heian Period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Shushi (Yoshiko)
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Shushi (Yoshiko) (December 14, 1141 - July 27, 1176) was Chugu (the Empress) of the Emperor Nijo.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Gishi (Noriko)
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Gishi (Noriko) (date of birth unknown - November 26, 879) was a member of the Imperial family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: KAJUJI Haruko
emperor.desc: Haruko KAJUJI (born 1553, died March 21, 1620) was the wife of Imperial Prince Sanehito, the fifth son of Emperor Ogimachi.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Ryoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Ryoshi (born 1147, died April 27, 1216) was the first daughter of the seventy-seventh Emperor Goshirakawa.

emperor.name: KUJO Ninshi
emperor.desc: Ninshi KUJO (born October 31, 1173, died February 3, 1239) was an empress and nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) from the end of Heian Period to Kamakura Period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Shoshi (or Akiko)
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Shoshi (or Akiko) (918 - February 7, 980) was from the Imperial family living in the mid Heian Period.

emperor.name: Japanese Imperial Family
emperor.desc: The Imperial Family is a generic term for the Emperor and the members of the Imperial Family.

emperor.name: Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
emperor.desc: Seiwa-Genji was a shisei kozoku (member of the Imperial Family conferred a family name) whose ancestor was the prince of the fifty-sixth Emperor, Seiwa.

emperor.name: Jinmu tenno sai (Emperor Jinmu Ceremony)
emperor.desc: Jinmu tenno sai (Emperor Jinmu Ceremony) refers to the ceremony of the Imperial Household to honor Emperor Jinmu.

emperor.name: Kannamesai
emperor.desc: Kannamesai (a.k.a. Kanname no Matsuri, Kannie no Matsuri) is a rite and festival of Ise-jingu Shrine and the imperial court.

emperor.name: Genshisai (shinto festival of origins)
emperor.desc: Genshi-sai Festival (the Shinto festival of origins) is one of taisaijitsu (the days when grand festivals are held) in the prewar public holiday system.

emperor.name: Maternal Relative
emperor.desc: The maternal relative is a family member of the mother or the consort of the emperor or the king.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Morikuni
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Morikuni (June 27, 1301- October 3, 1333) was the ninth seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and he was the last shogun of the Kamakura bakufu.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Morinaga
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Morinaga/Moriyoshi (1308 - August 20, 1335) lived from the latter half of the Kamakura period to the Kenmu Restoration period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Shushi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Shushi/Nagako (脩子) (February 1, 997 - March 19, 1049) was the first princess of the sixty sixth Emperor Ichijo, and her mother was Empress FUJIWARA no Teishi.

emperor.name: Kyuchu sanden (the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court)
emperor.url: emperor/Kyuchu sanden (the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court).html
emperor.desc: "Kyuchu Sanden" is a general term which refers to the three shrines in the Imperial Court: the Kashikodokoro (also known as Kensho), the Koreiden, and the Shinden.

emperor.name: Emperor Gokameyama
emperor.desc: Emperor Gokameyama (1347? - May 10, 1424) was the ninety-ninth Emperor in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) and the last and fourth Emperor in the Southern Court (reign: November/December 1383 - November 19, 1392).

emperor.name: Dajo Hoo (Cloistered Retired Emperor)
emperor.desc: Dajo Hoo (also referred to as Daijo Hoo) is a retired emperor (Dajo Tenno) who became a priest.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kanenaga
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kanenaga (Kaneyoshi) (c. 1329 - May 8, 1383) was the prince of Emperor Godaigo.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Atsuakira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Atsuakira (June 25, 994 - February 27, 1051) was the first prince of the sixty seventh Emperor Sanjo, and his mother was Empress FUJIWARA no Seishi, the daughter of FUJIWARA no Naritoki.

emperor.name: Ritual Day
emperor.desc: A ritual day is a day on which an important religious rite is performed.

emperor.name: Taiso no rei
emperor.desc: Taiso no rei means an Emperor's funeral which is conducted as an Imperial ceremony under the law of the Imperial House Act, Clause 25.

emperor.name: Miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court)
emperor.desc: Miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court) refers to the term that specifies four imperial princes who were assigned to seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") during the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Motoyoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Motoyoshi (890 - September 3, 943) was a member of the imperial family and waka poet during the mid Heian period.

emperor.name: MUNAKATA no Kiyouji
emperor.desc: MUNAKATA no Kiyouji (宗形 清氏) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family who was the first chief priest of Munakata-taisha Shrine (Munakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture).

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Takahito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Takahito (February 17, 1812 - January 24, 1886) was a member of the imperial family from the end of Edo period to Meiji period.

emperor.name: Prince Takami
emperor.desc: Prince Takami (year of his birth and death is unclear) was either a member of the Imperial Family or a member of the Imperial Family conferred a family name during the middle of Heian period.

emperor.name: Meiji setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji)
emperor.url: emperor/Meiji setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji).html
emperor.desc: The Meiji-setsu is one of the four grand national holidays in the former public holiday system: the Kigen-setsu (the National Foundation Day), the Shiho-setsu (New Year's Day), the Tencho-setsu (the birthday of the present emperor), and the Meiji-setsu (the birthday of Emperor Meiji).

emperor.name: Chinkon-sai Festival (mass or ceremony for the repose of a soul)
emperor.url: emperor/Chinkon-sai Festival (mass or ceremony for the repose of a soul).html
emperor.desc: Chinkon-sai Festival is a ritual ceremony for the repose of an emperor's soul on the day before Niname-sai (the Harvest Festival).

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Koreaki
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Koreaki (1179 - May 25, 1221) was the third prince of Emperor Takakura.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Sadazumi
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Sadazumi (873? - June 15, 916) was an Imperial family member of Japan in the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Princess Takahime
emperor.desc: Princess Takahime (隆姫女王) (995 - December 25, 1087) was the eldest daughter of Imperial Prince Tomohira, the seventh prince of Emperor Murakami.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Shokushi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Shokushi (Taneko) (1157 - October 22, 1228) was the Empress consort of Emperor Takakura.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Yushi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Yushi (Imperial Princess Sukeko/Imperial Princess Sachiko)

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Iyo
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Iyo (? - December 18, 807) is believed to be the third Imperial Prince of Emperor Kanmu, but there are different theories.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Shoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Shoshi (Masako) (950 - January 15, 1000) was the first princess of the 61st Emperor Suzaku.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Keishi (Kaoruko)
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Keishi (February 17, 1029 - September 26, 1093), who was also called Kaoruko, was the second imperial princess of the sixty-eighth emperor, Goichijo.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Kishi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Kishi (Yoshiko) (February 1, 1007 - September 5, 1025) was the sixth daughter of Sessho (Regent) FUJIWARA no Michinaga.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Ishi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Ishi (Takeko) (February 6, 1000 - October 4, 1036) was the fourth daughter of FUJIWARA no Michinaga, who held the title of Sessho (regent).

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Toshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Toshi (Masako) (1001 - October 16, 1022) was the first princess of Japan's 67th Emperor Sanjo.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Genshi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Genshi (Motoko) (August 21, 1016 - September 25, 1039) was an empress consort in the middle of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Gashi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Gashi (Masako) (910 - October 3, 954) was the 10th princess of the 60th Emperor Daigo.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Tokushi (as known as Atsuko)
emperor.url: emperor/Imperial Princess Tokushi (as known as Atsuko).html
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Tokushi (1060 - October 30, 1114) was the fourth princess of the seventy-first Emperor Gosanjo.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Inshi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Inshi (Taneko) (year of her birth is unclear - August 16, 896) was the daughter of Naidaijin (the Minister of the Center) FUJIWARA no Takafuji.

emperor.name: KIYOHARA no Natsuno
emperor.desc: KIYOHARA no Natsuno (782 - November 12, 837) was of the nobility and a politician in the early Heian period.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Moshi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Moshi (Shigeko) (the birth year is unknown - August 5, 1062) was the Empress of the 71st Emperor Gosanjo while he was Crown Prince, and 72nd Emperor Shirakawa's birth mother.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Kenshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Kenshi (October 25, 1032 - April 27, 1103) was the second princess of the sixty seventh Emperor Gosuzaku.

emperor.name: Mumongensen
emperor.desc: Mumongensen (March 30, 1323 - April 16, 1390) was the priest of the Rinzai sect during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

emperor.name: Monk Imperial Prince Saiun
emperor.desc: Cloistered Imperial Prince Saiun (1104 - March 10, 1162) was a monk of the Tendai sect of Buddhism in the middle of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Sonkan
emperor.desc: Sonkan (1349 - November 19, 1400) was a priest of the Ji sect during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tadafusa
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tadafusa (1285? - around August, 1347) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: MINAMOTO no Hikohito
emperor.desc: MINAMOTO no Hikohito was a member of the Imperial Family in the Kamakura period (His birth year is unknown and his date of death was May 12, 1298).

emperor.name: Prince Iwakuranomiya Tadanari
emperor.desc: Prince Iwakuranomiya Tadanari (1221 - April 23, 1279) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: FUSHIMINOMIYA Imperial Prince Kuninobu
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kuninobu FUSHIMINOMIYA (Mayl 3, 1566 - January 6, 1622) was a prince of imperial blood who lived from the Sengoku (warring states) period into the early Edo period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kazurawara
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kazurawara (December 1, 786 - July 17, 853), a member of the Imperial Family in the Heian period, was the founder of the Taira clan.

emperor.name: Ceremonies in the Imperial Court
emperor.desc: Various ceremonies associated with the emperor and Miyake (families allowed to be in status of the Imperial Family) are described below.

emperor.name: Senyomonin
emperor.desc: Senyomonin (November 20, 1181 - July 22, 1252) was nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) of the Imperial Family, who lived toward the end of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Meimei no Gi (naming ceremony)
emperor.desc: Meimei no gi is a ceremony for naming an imperial member on the seventh day (oshichiya) from his/her birthday.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Yoshimune
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Yotsutsujinomiya Yoshimune (1233 - May 18, 1317) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Sanehito (Heian period)
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Sanehito (March 20, 1071 - December 3, 1085) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Akinari
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Akinari (998 - May 23, 1035) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Kose
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Kose (c. 799 - September 24, 882) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Shoten-shoku (Ceremonial staff)
emperor.desc: The Shoten-shoku is a section in charge of Court rituals of the Japanese Imperial Household.

emperor.name: Prince Ichishino
emperor.desc: Prince Ichishino (733 - December 10, 805) was a member of the Imperial Family between the late Nara period and the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Court Ritual
emperor.desc: Court rituals are performed in order for an emperor to pray for peace, security, and prosperity of the nation and people.

emperor.name: Kunaicho Shikibushoku (the Board of the Ceremonies of the Imperial Household Agency)
emperor.url: emperor/Kunaicho Shikibushoku (the Board of the Ceremonies of the Imperial Household Agency).html
emperor.desc: Shikibushoku is one of the departments of the Imperial Household Agency.

emperor.name: Prince Okiyo
emperor.desc: Prince Okiyo (? - 940) was a member of the Imperial Family in the mid-Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Atsumichi
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Atsumichi (981 - November 20, 1007) was kajin (waka poet) from the Imperial Family during the middle of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Hirohira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Hirohira (950 - October 6, 971) was a member of the Imperial Family and the first Prince of Emperor Murakami during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Yorihito
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Yorihito (August 29, 1201 - June 25, 1264) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Renso no Gi
emperor.desc: Renso no gi is a funeral of an imperial member.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Munehira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Muneira (951 - March 30, 1041) was a member of the Imperial family in Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Mako
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Mako is a member of Imperial family of Japan.

emperor.name: Nosai no Gi (Ceremony of Exchanging Betrothal Presents)
emperor.url: emperor/Nosai no Gi (Ceremony of Exchanging Betrothal Presents).html
emperor.desc: Nosai no gi is one of the imperial ceremonies.

emperor.name: Koreisai
emperor.desc: Koreisai is a collective term for shunkikoreisai (imperial ceremony of ancestor worship formerly held on the vernal equinox) and shukikoreisai (imperial ceremony of ancestor worship formerly held on the autumnal equinox).

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Reiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Reiko (October 12, 1270 - August 30, 1307) was an Imperial Princess of Emperor Gofukakusa.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tametaka
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tametaka (977 - July 31, 1002) was a member of the Imperial family during the mid Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Yasuiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Yasuiko (ca. 848 - July 29, 913) was the thirty-first Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of Ise.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Ryoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Ryoshi (Nagako), January 25, 1030 - September 21, 1077, was the first daughter of Emperor Gosuzaku, the sixty-seventh Emperor of Japan.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Baishi (Daughter of Emperor Gosuzaku)
emperor.jp: ばい子内親王 (後朱雀天皇皇女)
emperor.url: emperor/Imperial Princess Baishi (Daughter of Emperor Gosuzaku).html
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Baishi (Miwako), September 16, 1039 - October 7, 1096, was the forth daughter of Emperor Gosuzaku.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Ishi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Ishi, 1076 - March 12, 1103, was an Imperial consort during the late Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Anshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Anshi (Yasuko), date of birth unknown - August 22, 900, was a member of the Imperial family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Princess Renshi
emperor.desc: Princess Renshi (Yasuko), the date of birth unknown - March 935, was a member of the Imperial family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Princess Yoshiko
emperor.desc: Princess Yoshiko (years of birth and death unknown), was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Koshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Koshi (also known as Yoshiko, year of birth unknown - August 12, 1192) was a member of the Imperial Family in the end of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Princess Ishi
emperor.desc: Princess Ishi (怡子女王) (also known as Yoshiko, years of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in the end of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Kishi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Kishi (also known as Yoshiko, years of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in the end of Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Kashi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Kashi (also known as Yoshiko, years of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in the latter period of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Yoshiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Yoshiko (僐子) (1159 - April 14, 1171) was a member of the Imperial Family in the latter period of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tadayoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tadayoshi (also known as Yukiyoshi, year of birth unknown - September 7, 1424) was a member of the Imperial Family in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) and the Muromachi period, and was also the second Prince of Imperial Prince Muneyoshi, and an Imperial descendant of Emperor Godaigo.

emperor.name: MINAMOTO no Kenshi (Kaneko)
emperor.desc: MINAMOTO no Kenshi (also known as Kaneko) (915 - October 972) was a shisei kozoku (member of the Imperial Family conferred with a family name) during the mid Heian period.

emperor.name: Princess Genshi
emperor.desc: Princess Genshi (also known a Motoko) (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family during the first half of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Ujiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Ujiko (year of birth unknown - May 23, 885) was a member of the Imperial Family during the first half of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Hisako
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Hisako (year of birth unknown - July 16, 876) was a member of the Imperial Family during the first half of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Ohara
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Ohara (year of birth unknown - February 14, 863) was a member of the Imperial Family during the first half of the Heian period.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Kinshi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Kinshi (also known as Yoshiko) (1134-September 19, 1209) was an empress during the end of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Tadako
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Tadako (also known as Seishi) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Eishi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Eishi (also known as Hideko) (921 - October 18, 946) was a member of the Imperial Family during the middle of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Okiyoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Okiyoshi (also known as Okinaga)

emperor.name: Princess Seishi
emperor.desc: Princess Seishi (also known as Nariko) (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family during the middle of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Princess Atsuko
emperor.desc: Princess Atsuko (also known as Junshi) (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family during the latter half of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Junshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Junshi (1093 - December 2, 1132) was a member of the Imperial Family during the latter half of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Atsuko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Atsuko (also known as Junshi) (1158 - June 3, 1172) was a member of the Imperial Family during the end of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Taiso
emperor.desc: Taiso means imperial funeral of an emperor, empress, grand empress dowager, empress dowager and empress consort.

emperor.name: TOIN Kitsushi
emperor.desc: Kitsushi TOIN (FUJIWARA no Kitsushi) (Empress Kitsushi) (1245 - September 9, 1272) was an empress of Emperor Kameyama during the Kamakura period, and she was the birth mother of Emperor Gouda.

emperor.name: ISE no Tsugiko
emperor.desc: ISE no Tsugiko (born 772, died July 6, 812 (old lunar calendar) (August 16, 812)) was the wife of Emperor Heizei.

emperor.name: MINAMOTO no Genshi
emperor.desc: MINAMOTO no Genshi (Takeko) (year of birth unknown - July 23, 879) was Nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court - a consort of an emperor) of Emperor Seiwa.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Ate
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Ate (year of birth unknown - November 4, 855) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: SAIONJI Kishi
emperor.desc: Kishi SAIONJI (also known as FUJIWARA no Kishi and Empress Kishi, 1252 - June 3, 1318) was a chugu (the second consort of an emperor) of Emperor Kameyama during the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: OINOMIKADO Reishi
emperor.desc: Reishi OINOMIKADO (also known as FUJIWARA no Reishi and Empress Reishi, 1185 - November 8, 1243) was a chugu of Emperor Tsuchimikado during the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: FUJIWARA no Seishi
emperor.desc: FUJIWARA no Seishi (also known as Sukeko, 972 - May 1, 1025) was the Empress of the sixty-seventh Emperor Sanjo during the middle of the Heian period.

emperor.name: TAIRA no Suenaga
emperor.desc: TAIRA no Suenaga (date of birth unknown - to August 23, 897) was a nobleman in the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Shoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Shoshi (September 28, 1286 - November 23, 1348) was a member of the Imperial Family from the latter Kamakura period to the beginning of the Muromachi period (the period of the Northern and Southern Courts - Japan).

emperor.name: Suzakuin
emperor.desc: Suzakuin is:

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Nagako
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Nagako (year of birth unknown - March 27, 914) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Ekishi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Ekishi (1262 - December 20, 1294) was nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) of the Imperial Family during the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Prince Masamochi
emperor.desc: Prince Masamochi (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Prince Masamichi
emperor.desc: Prince Masamichi (821 - July 7, 841) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tsuneyasu
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tsuneyasu (year of birth unknown - July 1, 869) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Tsuneyo
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Tsuneyo (805 - June 13, 826) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Doson (Prince of Prince Mochihito)
emperor.desc: Doson (1175 - 1228) was a member of the Imperial Family and a priest during the end of the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Baishi (Princess of Emperor Gouda)
emperor.jp: ばい子内親王 (後宇多天皇皇女)
emperor.url: emperor/Imperial Princess Baishi (Princess of Emperor Gouda).html
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Baishi (year of birth and death unknown) was the second Princess of Emperor Gouda.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Tokiko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Tokiko (date of birth unknown - March 6, 847) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Koretada
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Koretada (857 - December 18, 922) was a member of the Imperial Family during in the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Koresada
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Koresada (date of birth unknown - August 25, 903) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Tameko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Tameko (year and date of birth unknown - May 1, 899) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Atsuko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Atsuko (year of birth unknown - February 19, 930) was a member of the Imperial Family during the mid Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Prince Noriakira
emperor.desc: Imperial Prince Noriakira (907 - February 4, 967) was a member of the Imperial Family during the mid Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Izu
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Izu (year of birth unknown, died on October 30, 861) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.

emperor.name: Ogawanomiya
emperor.desc: Ogawanomiya (June 1404 - March 15, 1425) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Muromachi period.

emperor.name: Emperor Matsunaga
emperor.desc: Emperor Matsunaga (August 8, 1364 - May 24, 1417) was an ancestor of Yoshimasa MIURA, who advocated the orthodoxy of the Southern Court after World War II, and was the fourth Emperor of the MIURA Imperial Line.

emperor.name: Emperor Kokoku
emperor.desc: Emperor Kokoku (September 1328 - March 1397) was an ancestor of Yoshimasa MIURA, who advocated the Legitimate Succession of the Southern Court after World War II, and was the second Emperor of the MIURA Imperial Line.

emperor.name: Emperor Komatsu
emperor.desc: Emperor Komatsu (March 14, 1334 - 1375) was an ancestor of Yoshimasa MIURA, who advocated the Legitimate Succession of the Southern Court after World War II, and was the third Emperor of the Miura Imperial Line.

emperor.name: OGURANOMIYA Tsuneatsu
emperor.desc: Tsuneatsu OGURANOMIYA (year of birth unknown - August 11, 1422) was a Prince of Emperor Gokameyama, who was the 99th Emperor in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, and was the fourth and last Emperor of the Southern Court.

emperor.name: Sonshuo
emperor.desc: Jitenno (1440 - December 18, 1457) was the last leader of the Gonancho (the Second Southern Court) who attempted to rebuild the Southern Court (Japan).

emperor.name: Oguranomiya Seisho
emperor.desc: Oguranomiya Seisho (date of birth unknown - June 13, 1443) was the grandson of Emperor Gokameyama, the ninety-ninth Emperor during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), or the fourth and the last Emperor of the Southern Court (Japan), and the son of Oguranomiya Tsuneatsu.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Hoshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Hoshi (Sukeko) (953 - April 13, 992) was a member of the Imperial Family during the middle of the Heian period.

emperor.name: YOSHIMINE no Nagamatsu
emperor.desc: YOSHIMINE no Nagamatsu (813 - December 30, 879) was a government official who lived during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Prince Songa
emperor.desc: Prince Songa (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family during the late Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Teruko
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Akenomiya Teruko (July 25, 1634 - November 18, 1727) was a member of the Imperial Family in the early Edo period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Kinshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Kinshi (890 - April 12, 910) was a member of the Imperial Family and a princess during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Imperial Princess Kunshi
emperor.desc: Imperial Princess Kunshi (date of birth unknown - November 15, 902) was a princess from the Imperial Family during the Heian period.

emperor.name: Reizeiin
emperor.desc: Reizeiin was an Imperial Palace for the emperor who abdicated the throne during the Heian period.

emperor.name: SAIONJI Koshi
emperor.desc: Koshi SAIONJI (1232 - March 6, 1304) was a women who lived during the Kamakura period.

emperor.name: Emperor Jimmu
emperor.desc: Emperor Jimmu (February 13, 711 B.C. ? - April 9, 585 B.C. ?) was legendarily the first emperor in Japan.

emperor.name: Emperor Suinin
emperor.desc: Emperor Suinin (January 26, 69 B.C. - August 8, 70) was the eleventh emperor according to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) (reigning from February 2, 29 B.C. to August 6, 70).

emperor.name: Kesshi-Hachidai
emperor.desc: The expression "eight undocumented eras" ("kesshi hachidai" in Japanese) refers to the eight emperors from Emperor Suizei (second emperor) to Emperor Kaika (ninth emperor) whose pedigree records (called "Teiki" in Japanese) exist but whose achievements are not recorded in "Kojiki" and "Nihon Shoki" and the period represented by these emperors.

emperor.name: Emperor Suizei
emperor.desc: Emperor Suizei (632 B.C. ? - June 28, 549 B.C. ?) was the second emperor (tenure: February 23, 581 B.C. ? - June 28, 549 B.C. ?) of Japan.

emperor.name: Emperor Annei
emperor.desc: Emperor Annei (577 B.C.- January 11, 510 B.C.) is the third emperor, who was described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) (Reign: August 13, 549 B.C. -January 11, 510 B.C.).

emperor.name: Isuzuyori hime no mikoto
emperor.desc: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Kujihoongi" (Ancient Japanese History), Isuzuhime no mikoto, also called Isuzuyorihime (date of birth and death unknown) was a wife of Emperor Suizei, a daughter of Kotoshironushi-no-kami (her mother's name is unknown) and a mother of Emperor Annei.

emperor.name: Kawamatabime
emperor.desc: Kawatabime is considered to have been a wife of Emperor Suizei and a mother of Emperor Annei.

emperor.name: Emperor Jomei
emperor.desc: Emperor Jomei (593? - November 20, 641) was the thirty-fourth emperor in Japan (reigned: February 5, 629 - November 20, 641).

emperor.name: Imperial Mausoleum
emperor.desc: An imperial mausoleum is a grave designated as an emperor's grave by the Imperial Household Agency.

emperor.name: Emperor Itoku
emperor.desc: Emperor Itoku (553 B.C. - October 1, 477 B.C.) was the fourth emperor (reign: March 9, 510 B.C.- October 1, 477 B.C.), being described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: The Emperor Tenmu
emperor.desc: According to "the Kotofu" (the genealogy of the Imperial Family), the Emperor Tenmu (631 - October 1, 686) is the 40th emperor of Japan. (rein: March 20, 673 - Oct 1, 686)

emperor.name: Empress Jito
emperor.desc: Empress Jito (645 – January 17, 703) was the forty-first imperial ruler (empress regnant) of Japan.

emperor.name: Emperor Keiko
emperor.desc: Emperor Keiko (13 B.C. - December 23, A.D. 130) was the twelfth emperor (reign: August 22, A.D. 71-December 23, A.D. 130), being described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: Empress Jingu
emperor.desc: Empress Jingu (A.D. 170 - June 3, A.D. 269) was a wife of Emperor Chuai.

emperor.name: Emperor Kosho
emperor.desc: Emperor Kosho (506 B.C. - September 5, 393 B.C.) was the fifth emperor (reign: February 21, 475 B.C. - September 5, 393 B.C.), being described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: Emperor Koan
emperor.desc: Emperor Koan (427 B.C. - February 23, 291 B.C.) was the sixth emperor (reign: February 26, 392 B.C. - February 23, 291 B.C.), being described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: TACHIBANA no Moroe
emperor.desc: TACHIBANA no Moroe (684 – February 3, 757) was a politician in the Nara period, originated in the Imperial family.

emperor.name: Emperor Gomurakami
emperor.desc: Emperor Gomurakami (1328 - April 6, 1368) was the 97th emperor in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (in Japan) and the second emperor of the Southern Court. (He reigned from September 26, 1339 until April 6, 1368).

emperor.name: Emperor Chokei
emperor.desc: Emperor Chokei (1343 – September 4, 1394; reign: April 6, 1368 – November 1383) was the ninety-eighth emperor of Japan, who lived in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

emperor.name: Emperor Korei
emperor.desc: Emperor Korei (342 B.C. – March 23, 215 B.C.) is the seventh emperor (the period of reign: February 15, 290 B.C. – March 23, 215 B.C.) recorded in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: Emperor Kogen
emperor.desc: Emperor Kogen (273 B.C. – October 14, 158 B.C.) is the eighth emperor (reigned from February 21, 214 B.C. to October 14, 158 B.C.) written in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: Emperor Kaika
emperor.desc: Emperor Kaika (208 B.C. – May 21, 98 B.C.) is the ninth emperor (reigned from November 12, 158 B.C. to May 21, 98 B.C.) written in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: Emperor Sujin
emperor.desc: Emperor Sujin (148 B.C. - January 9, 29 B.C.) was the tenth emperor of Japan (reigned from February 17, 97 B.C. to January 9, 29 B.C.) recorded in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihon Shoki" (The Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: Emperor Seimu
emperor.desc: Emperor Seimu (84 – July 29, 190) was the 13th emperor (reigned from February 18, 131 to July 29, 190) written in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

emperor.name: Emperor Chuai
